metadata.title: CVE-2024-36925 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:swiotlb: initialise restricted pool list_head when SWIOTLB_DYNAMIC=y Usingrestricted DMA pools (CONFIG_DMA_RESTRICTED_POOL=y) in conjunction withdynamic SWIOTLB (CONFIG_SWIOTLB_DYNAMIC=y) leads to the following crashwhen initialising the restricted pools at boot-time: | Unable to handlekernel NULL pointer dereference at virtual address 0000000000000008 |Internal error: Oops: 0000000096000005 [#1] PREEMPT SMP | pc :rmem_swiotlb_device_init+0xfc/0x1ec | lr :rmem_swiotlb_device_init+0xf0/0x1ec | Call trace: |rmem_swiotlb_device_init+0xfc/0x1ec |of_reserved_mem_device_init_by_idx+0x18c/0x238 |of_dma_configure_id+0x31c/0x33c | platform_dma_configure+0x34/0x80faddr2line reveals that the crash is in the list validation code:include/linux/list.h:83 include/linux/rculist.h:79include/linux/rculist.h:106 kernel/dma/swiotlb.c:306kernel/dma/swiotlb.c:1695 because add_mem_pool() is trying tolist_add_rcu() to a NULL 'mem->pools'. Fix the crash by initialising the'mem->pools' list_head in rmem_swiotlb_device_init() before callingadd_mem_pool().
